original: Dahlberg, Elis Fredrik Leopold, fd. rektor, Karlshamn, f. 1/4/77 i Simrishamn av kyrkoh. Walfrid D. o. Bertha Runstedt. G. 09 m. Gertrud Bergh. Barn: Ingrid f. 13, Gert 16. — Stud:-ex. 94, fil. kand. i Lund 98, teor. o. prakt, teol, ex. 02. E. lär. i Simrishamn 99-00, vik. adj. o. vik. lektor i Kristianstad 04-07, rektors sekr. 05-07, ord. adj. i Arvika 07-12, rektor i Piteå 12-25, rektor v. Karlshamns re-alsk. o. komm. gymn. 25-42. Led. av stadsfullm. i Arvika 11-12, förest, f. Arvika tekn. yrkessk. 09-12, led. av stadsfullm. i Piteå 14-25, ordf. 15, 16 o. 21-25, ordf. i Piteå hamndirekt. 14-19, v. oTdif. i ff(olkisk:,sityr. 18-25, i las:-direkt. 14-25, ordf. i tax:nd 22-25, led. ’av landstinget i Norrb. 1. 21-22, Led. av stadsfullm. i Karlshamn 27-36, ordf. i beiredtn:uts(k. 28-3’l, i sfadsfullm. 35-36, i lönend 27-36, i ’Styr. f. ’stadsbibl. 26-38, i lokalstyr. f. ’samrealsk. 29-42 o. i ’Styr. f. komm. gymn. 25-40, iled. av Blek. 1. |landsting 35-38 o. av alilm. kyrkomötet 15, tryckfrih :omb. 28-39, huv :man i Karlshamns Sparbank, ordf. i tax:nd sed. 43. RVO 23.
translated: Dahlberg, Elis Fredrik Leopold, former principal from Karlshamn, born on April 1st, 1877 in Simrishamn to vicar Walfrid D. and Bertha Runstedt. Married in 1909 to Gertrud Bergh, with two children: Ingrid born in 1913 and Gert born in 1916. He earned his degree from Lund University in 1894 and his Bachelor of Philosophy in 1898. He passed his theoretical and practical theological exams in 1902. He worked as a teacher in Simrishamn from 1899-1900, as temporary adjutant and temporary lecturer in Kristianstad from 1904-1907, and as the rector's secretary from 1905-1907. He was appointed ordained adjutant in Arvika from 1907-1912 and rector in Piteå from 1912-1925. He served as vice-rector of Karlshamn's high school and municipal gymnasium from 1925-1942. Dahlberg was a member of Arvika's city council from 1911-1912 and headed the Technical Vocational School from 1909-1912. He was a member of Piteå's city council from 1914-1925 and chaired in 1915, 1916, and from 1921-1925. He was also the chairman of Piteå's port authority from 1914-1919 and vice-chairman in the County Administrative Board from 1918-1925 and the County Council for Health and Welfare from 1914-1925. He chaired the taxation committee from 1922-1925 and was a member of the Norrbotten County Council in 1921-1922. He served as a member of Karlshamn's city council from 1927-1936 and chaired the board of directors from 1928-1931. He was also a member of the city council in 1935-1936, held a salary position from 1927-1936, and chaired the city library board from 1926-1938. Additionally, he was a member of the local board of directors for the municipal high school from 1929-1942 and the board of directors for the municipal gymnasium from 1925-1940. He was a member of the Blekinge County Council from 1935-1938, a member of the general church meeting in 1915, and served on the Commission on Freedom of the Press from 1928-1939. He was the chairman of Karlshamn Savings Bank and served on the Taxation Committee since 1943. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1923.
